sailpoint.server
Interface WorkItemHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
WorkflowHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWorkflowHandler, StandardWorkflowHandler, TaskManager
public interface WorkItemHandler

The interface of a class that can be registered to handle modification to work items. Handlers will be called automatically as changes to work items are committed.

The handler might have side effects such as deleting a completed work item, changing ownership, enabling a pending object, etc.

Currently it is necessary for system components to use a Workflower object to call the handlers. Handlers should not be called directly, nor are they called as a side effect of committing a change.

Method Summary
 void forwardWorkItem(SailPointContext con, WorkItem item, Identity newOwner)
          Called by the system when ownership changes.
 void handleWorkItem(SailPointContext con, WorkItem item, boolean foreground)
          Called by the system after a modification to the work item has been stored.
 void validateWorkItem(SailPointContext con, WorkItem item)
          Called by the system before a work item is about to be stored.

validateWorkItem

void validateWorkItem(SailPointContext con,
                      WorkItem item)
                      throws GeneralException
Called by the system before a work item is about to be stored. This can throw validation exceptions.

Throws:
GeneralException

handleWorkItem

void handleWorkItem(SailPointContext con,
                    WorkItem item,
                    boolean foreground)
                    throws GeneralException
Called by the system after a modification to the work item has been stored. Foreground should be true if this is a UI request thread or any other thread that does not want to give up control for an indefinite period of time wile the case advances. Usually the advance is fast, but you cannot assume that.

Throws:
GeneralException
